concept.title: OAuth 2 Authorization
concept.shortdesc: You can configure the HTTP Client destination to use the OAuth 2 protocol to connect to an HTTP service that uses basic, digest, or universal authentication, OAuth 2 client credentials, OAuth 2 username and password, or OAuth 2 JSON Web Tokens (JWT).

conbody.p: HTTP Client destinationOAuth 2OAuth 2HTTP Client destinationThe OAuth 2 protocol authorizes third-party access to HTTP service resources without sharing credentials. The HTTP Client destination uses credentials to request an access token from the service. The service returns the token to the destination, and then the destination includes the token in a header in each request to the resource URL.
